item.title: The Humane Technical Interview
item.description:
Description

Nearly everyone in tech has to take part in a technical interview during their career, but are we doing them right?
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: Accessibility: Myths and Delusions by Katie Cunningham
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: Pycon 2010: 508 and You: Taking the Pain out of Accessibility (#119)
item.description:
Description

508 and You: Taking the Pain out of Accessibility

Presented by Katie A Cunningham (NASA/Indyne)

Thinking about scoring a government contract, but haven't heard of 508 compliance yet? Interested in making your site accessible to people with disabilities? Never thought about compliance, but want to know why it's a good idea?
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: 12. Accessibility and You
item.description:
Summary

An introduction into the world of 508 compliance.
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: A Noob Speaks to Noobs: Your First Site in the Cloud
item.description:
Summary

A developer talks about her lessons learned with setting up her first server, and offers advice to others about to tread that path.
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: Introduction to Game Development
item.description:
Summary

This tutorial will walk the attendees from some introductory game development theory (what makes a good game) and through development of a simple game (how to make a good game) with time left over for some experimentation and exploration of different types of games.
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham

item.title: The Young Coder: Let's Learn Python
item.description:
Summary

Since PyCon 2013, interest in the Young Coders class has intensified. Several Python conferences have run their own, and classes outside of conferences - from one-time workshops to after school clubs - have sprung up as well. With more people than ever interested in teaching Python to kids, we're here to address how to organize a class. It takes some effort to set up, but the payoff is enormous.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Shaurette

item.title: Usability Testing on the Cheap
item.description:
Description

While everyone agrees that usability testing should be an important part of your development process, not everyone has enough money laying around to pay for a dedicated team or consultants. In this talk, Katie will review a number of inexpensive options that can help any team deliver a usable product.
item.dc:creator: Katie Cunningham
